div.head: Thomas Stone Will
div.p:
I Thomas Stone of Charles County in the province of maryland of
body but of perfect memory doe by these presents make thus my last
will and testamanet and do make said all other will or wills testament on
testaments by me forely made or declared and thus to be taken for my
True will and testament amd now after.

I make and ordaine my love wife Mary Stone my sole Executor for the
use and behold of my dear sons William Stone and Richard Stone
I give unto my dear son Richard Stone that plantation that is now in
possession of Simon Stevens after his lease is expird also all that land
of mine running from the said plantation up the main branch untill it
comes up to the main Rpad and there to bound and from there with alone
drawn East untill it comes to Matawoman path that goes cross the main
Road there to bound and from there running South untill it comes down
the head of a branch called White Marsh lying there east Richard
and Simon Stevens his and after decease to be laid out by my Exec.
within five months for the use of my son Richard Stone it being part of
Pognton Manner.

I give unt o my sonn William Stone all the other my land and plantation as
alsoe my new negro woman Margrett and my black mares filly for his use on my
now plantation with her increase and three cow and three sowes one feather hen &
furniture.
furniture and also my silver tankard to be delievered to my son William
Stone when he shall arive at the age of eighteen as also my sons sae
life him shall be delieverd to the said William Stone at the age of
eighteen and if he die them t Richard Stone.

I give unto my son Richard Srone my negro man and one maine
fily this year to be bought and my Executor and to own on my plantation
with her increase for the use of my son Richard as also three cows &
three sowes and my silver salt them to be delieverd to him when he shall
arrive at the age of eighteen and that his land may the be delievered to him
and if he happen to die before he arrive to the age of eighteen the the said
land ad chattles to be son William Stone I give to Richard one
feather bed and

I give unto my Executor all the remainder of my goods and chattles
the finding my sons maintainance and Education and that they be
not charged for any thing but have their legars when they shall
arrive at the age of eighteen as witness my land and seal this the four and
twentieth day of april in the year of our Lord One Thousand six hundred
seventy six

Signed sealed
In the presence of us
John Stone
Elizabeth Stone
Thomas Stone

On the back of the aforegoing will was Endorsed the folly & probate by
Maryland Js. Sept. 25th 1676 by vitue of a commission from the
judge in testantary casues within the province dated the 12th day of
1676 I called before me John Stone and Elizabeth Stone witnesses to the within
written will who proved the same by this oaths before me
5 1/2
Benjamin Rozer
